name: Dawn of the Dajjal
description:
In Islamic eschatology, Dajjāl, -in Arabic means “The Deceiver”-, is a false messianic figure who will come forth before the end of time; first appeared as the Antichrist in pseudo-apocalyptic Christian literature and is reworked in ḥadīth (sayings) ascribed to the Prophet Muhammad. Dajjāl will appear during a period of great tribulation. He will work false miracles, and most people will be deceived. 

As we enter the miraculous age of Artificial Intelligence, all these myths and descriptions around the figure of Dajjāl are becoming more of a self fulfilled prophecy. And it seems like the dawn might already be here.
